SAD — Architecture Definitions (Structure)

Architecture: Architectural Patterns SAD-1
links outgoing: FSD-1.1
links incoming: SAD-1.1, SAD-1.2, SAD-1.3, SAD-1.4, ICD-2, TDD-1.5
Architecture: **Hub-and-Spoke:** Core Process acts as the central `ROUTER` (Hub); Services are `DEALER` (Spokes). SAD-1.1
links outgoing: SAD-1
Architecture: **Decoupled Sink:** Dedicated LogServer acts as `PULL` sink for `PUSH` sources. SAD-1.2
links outgoing: SAD-1
Architecture: **No Shared Abstraction:** `ROUTER-DEALER` and `PUSH-PULL` patterns are implemented separately to avoid artificial coupling. SAD-1.3
links outgoing: SAD-1
Architecture: **Context Propagation:** `request_id` must be passed in every frame. SAD-1.4
links outgoing: SAD-1
Architecture: Process Topology SAD-2
links outgoing: FSD-1.1
links incoming: TDD-1
 
        graph LR
   subgraph Services ["External Services (DEALER)"]
      direction TB
      UI["UI"]
      Runtime["Runtime"]
      Audio["Audio"]
   end

   Core["Core Process (ROUTER)"]
   LogServer["LogServer (PULL)"]

   %% Bidirectional Request-Response (ROUTER-DEALER)
   %% Using explicit links for clarity in LR, Core is the Hub
   UI <==> Core
   Runtime <==> Core
   Audio <==> Core

   %% Unidirectional Fire-and-Forget (PUSH-PULL)
   %% Dotted lines for logging
   UI -. PUSH .-> LogServer
   Runtime -. PUSH .-> LogServer
   Audio -. PUSH .-> LogServer
   Core -. PUSH .-> LogServer

   %% Styling
   classDef core fill:#e1f5fe,stroke:#0277bd,stroke-width:2px,rx:5,ry:5;
   classDef service fill:#fff3e0,stroke:#ef6c00,stroke-width:2px,rx:5,ry:5;
   classDef sink fill:#e8f5e9,stroke:#2e7d32,stroke-width:2px,rx:5,ry:5;

   class Core core;
   class UI,Runtime,Audio service;
   class LogServer sink;

   %% Curve smoothing
   linkStyle default interpolate basis
Architecture: Integration Strategy SAD-3
links outgoing: FSD-6.1, NFR-2.1, NFR-2
links incoming: SAD-3.1, SAD-3.2, SAD-3.3, SAD-3.4, SAD-3.5, SAD-3.6, SAD-3.7, SAD-3.8, ICD-2, TDD-1.3, TDD-1.10, TDD-2, TDD-2.5, TDD-3.3
Architecture: **Core ↔ Services (Request-Response):** SAD-3.1
links outgoing: SAD-3
Architecture: **Pattern:** ZeroMQ `ROUTER` (Core) ↔ `DEALER` (Service). SAD-3.2
links outgoing: SAD-3
Architecture: **Type:** Bidirectional. SAD-3.3
links outgoing: SAD-3
Architecture: **Requirement:** Core maintains routing table (client identity → socket identity). SAD-3.4
links outgoing: SAD-3
Architecture: **All Processes → LogServer (Logging):** SAD-3.5
links outgoing: SAD-3
Architecture: **Pattern:** ZeroMQ `PUSH` (Client) → `PULL` (LogServer). SAD-3.6
links outgoing: SAD-3
Architecture: **Type:** Unidirectional, Fire-and-Forget. SAD-3.7
links outgoing: SAD-3
Architecture: **Requirement:** Senders must set `SNDHWM=100` and `LINGER=0` to buffer micro-bursts without blocking. SAD-3.8
links outgoing: SAD-3
Architecture: Concurrency Model SAD-4
links outgoing: NFR-5.1
links incoming: SAD-4.1, SAD-4.2, SAD-4.3, SAD-4.4, SAD-4.5, SAD-4.6, SAD-4.7, SAD-4.8, SAD-4.9, ICD-3, TDD-1.7, TDD-1.8, TDD-2, TDD-2.6, TDD-2.7, TDD-2.9
Architecture: **Receiver Threads:** Each process uses a dedicated thread to poll ZMQ sockets and push to an internal `queue.PriorityQueue`. SAD-4.1
links outgoing: SAD-4
Architecture: **Main Loop:** The main application loop processes the `PriorityQueue` to remain non-blocking. SAD-4.2
links outgoing: SAD-4
Architecture: **Queueing:** SAD-4.3
links outgoing: SAD-4
Architecture: Must use `queue.PriorityQueue`. SAD-4.4
links outgoing: SAD-4
Architecture: **Structure:** `(priority, counter, message)`. SAD-4.5
links outgoing: SAD-4
Architecture: **Ordering:** Monotonic counter (`itertools.count`) ensures FIFO within priority levels. SAD-4.6
links outgoing: SAD-4
Architecture: **Priority Levels:** SAD-4.7
links outgoing: SAD-4
Architecture: **High (0):** `shutdown`, `error_notification`, `state_change`. SAD-4.8
links outgoing: SAD-4
Architecture: **Normal (1):** Inference requests, status updates. SAD-4.9
links outgoing: SAD-4
Architecture: Configuration Driven SAD-5
links outgoing: BRD-3.2
links incoming: SAD-5.1, ICD-1
Architecture: All IPC endpoints (addresses, ports) and parameters (queue sizes, timeouts) must be loaded from `ipc_config.yaml`. SAD-5.1
links outgoing: SAD-5
